summary: This bill, the Producing Incentives for Long-term production of Lifesaving Supply of medicine Act (PILLS Act), aims to incentivize the domestic production of generic drugs and biosimilars. It establishes a production credit based on value added, with increased percentages for certain components and a domestic content bonus. It also introduces an investment credit for qualified facilities. Both credits can be utilized via elective payments and transfers. The bill includes definitions, outlines phase-out provisions, and specifies effective dates for the introduced incentives.
